posts.post_content:
Chandra seems to be one of the most versatile Planes walkers, and can easily be run 4x.   
She has the most loyalty counters. 5 Mana for 6 damage is better than most red spells and kills most targets. Remove her last counters and just cast another to stack damage!   
Her +1 is not the best but it will directly progress victory, or it can suppress enemy planes walkers!   
Only Garuk has a faster ultimate ability requiring creatures in play and Sarkahn's dragons still take another turn to hit. If your opponent wont die they still wont have any creatures.   
She is actually an amazing control card more than agro, as removal and a win condition. Chandra is HOT!

Her +1 is not the best but it will directly progress victory, or it can suppress enemy planes walkers!
Only Garuk has a faster ultimate ability requiring creatures in play and Sarkahn's dragons still take another turn to hit. If your opponent wont die they still wont have any creatures.
She is actually an amazing control card more than agro, as removal and a win condition. Chandra is HOT!

Posted By: Chromatone (7/22/2009 8:49:53 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
Chandra is heavily underrated. She sees so little play because there isn't a deck that really needs her, not because she isn't a good card. Post-wrath, plopping down a Chandra and threatening her ultimate is amazing. She's repeatable removal against small creatures. She can blow up a Baneslayer Angel and stick around to ping them afterwards, and if they don't deal with her, she can blow up another creature later. She's one of the best planeswalkers at protecting herself. And because of her high starting loyalty, she's pretty tough to dispatch.  
  
At least planeswalker control decks are running her as two-ofs. She deserves to be played more than she currently is.
posts.html:
Chandra is heavily underrated. She sees so little play because there isn't a deck that really needs her, not because she isn't a good card. Post-wrath, plopping down a Chandra and threatening her ultimate is amazing. She's repeatable removal against small creatures. She can blow up a Baneslayer Angel and stick around to ping them afterwards, and if they don't deal with her, she can blow up another creature later. She's one of the best planeswalkers at protecting herself. And because of her high starting loyalty, she's pretty tough to dispatch.

At least planeswalker control decks are running her as two-ofs. She deserves to be played more than she currently is.

She is so hot!

posts.post_content:
The best of the planeswalkers!!!  
  
Great artwork, especially in the duel deck version, and REALLY powerful.  
  
A **must have** for any red deck!!!!!  
  
Chandra is one of the most powerfull plansewalker cards out there.  
She has high starting loyalty which can help her survive long enough to build enough points and activate her ultimate attack.  
Her first ability helps build up her loyalty while at the same time you can destroy your opponent's monsters or lower his life points.  
Chandra's second ability is something like a Fireball aimed only at creatures. You can kill almost any creature simply by using Chandra's starting loyalty points.  
Now it is time to activate her thir ability, her ultimate spell, and watch your opponent burn in cathartic flames allong with his creatures. It is something like a red version of Wrath of God. 10 points of damage to every creature is way too much and 10 points of damage to the life points of a player all in one turn is almost certain death. And even if ... [(see all)](javascript:void(0);)

posts.post_content:
I have a friend who mainly plays an elf deck and I mainly play a red creature/burn deck. He opened a zendikar booster and pulled out a Nissan, which was boding very ill for me. Then the very next day I bought 2 m10 boosters and pulled out this babe... talk about balancing the decks ;)
  
Love this one, if not dealt with, she quickly unleashes her devastating ultimate, and while charging she can even keep other planes walkers down, and she fits in any deck that has just a little red in it, and she is particularily hard to deal with, considering her high starting loyalty. AWESOME!
